newsitem.title: USA: Rite Aid completes Thrifty PayLess merger.
newsitem.headline: Rite Aid completes Thrifty PayLess merger.

text.p: Rite Aid Corp said on Thursday it completed its merger with Thrifty PayLess Holdings Inc.
Each Thrifty PayLess share will be converted into 0.65 shares of Rite Aid common stock. Rite Aid said it would issue about 38.7 million shares of common stock as part of the deal.
The transaction was approved by the holders of 81.3 percent of Rite Aid stock and by the holders of 77.1 percent of Thrifty PayLess stock, Rite Aid said.
The merger creates a chain of more than 3,500 drugstores with annual revenues of more than $10 billion.
Rite Aid's shares were down 1/2 at 39-1/2 in midafternoon trading on the New York Stock Exchange.
